metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17382 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in zabbix.php?action=dashboard.view&dashboardid=1in Zabbix through 4.4. An attacker can bypass the login page and access thedashboard page, and then create a Dashboard, Report, Screen, or Map withoutany Username/Password (i.e., anonymously). All created elements(Dashboard/Report/Screen/Map) are accessible by other users and by anadmin.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.0.2+dfsg-1').
